articles.author: tool2d
articles.description:
tool2d: 现在笔记本 CPU 都是性能过剩。不同的厂商，采用不同的散热方案，就算同一款 CPU ，跑分结果也是天差地别。
因为散热决定了功耗上限和长时间性能释放，有些笔记本看起来 boost 频率拉的很高，但是 3 秒就过热降频了。
有个国外测评网站，把所有用户跑分和笔记本型号都对应起来。那么只需要找一款新 CPU ，按照最强的用户跑分排序，对应的就是某笔记本型号的散热能力。
举个例子，要查 N6000 十一代 CPU ，访问
https://cpu.userbenchmark.com/SpeedTest/1403932/IntelR-PentiumR-Silver-N6000---110GHz
点跑分最高的用户，那么前三名型号就是（最强散热）
Acer Aspire A315-35
Acer Aspire A115-32
Acer Aspire A317-33
articles.title: 偶然间，发现了一个选购笔记本的好方法。

articles.author: pyre
articles.description:
pyre: 喷 3 眼看着就要发售了，想要认识更多的喷 3 的同好萌新！
(粉丝大多数叫喷喷，来源于民间翻译喷射战士，简称喷喷，没有多余的意思...）
企鹅群
base64: NTU0NjE0OTM3
群文件附带:
·喷 2 全套萌新带大佬教辅资料（喷 2 无中文，非常需要）
·每周一次的群友私房娱乐房（如果群主不咕咕咕都会有，会遇到更高层级的玩家）
·一起讨论喷 3 各种各样情报咨询（竞技游戏互动性比较高，也适合交流提升）
·没有意义的摸鱼水群
总之欢迎大家在喷 3 入坑，有中文哦！
（喷 2 入坑的我没人铺路，这次我来铺！）
articles.title: SPLATOON3（斯普拉遁 3）要发售了

articles.author: luodaoyi
articles.description:
luodaoyi: 
但是测速还是跑不满 1000M 只能 900+ 上行也 100 左右
我看了看光猫 感觉有可能是光猫的问题光猫型号是 h3-8s 四个千兆电口 明显跑不满 1000M 宽带
买了个诺基亚猫棒跟光纤收发机.
但是今天公网开通后，装机老哥告诉我 不要换光猫:
公网 ip 不能换终端的 换了就没了 我领导是这样说的 好不容易搞起来，等下换个设备换没了就不好搞了
说是绑定了光猫
换了可能会丢公网 ip
咋弄 换还是不换啊， 这玩意怎么绑定的，能不能用猫棒完全模拟这个光猫？
articles.title: 杭州移动成功开通公网 ip 但是 1000M 还是跑不满 想换猫棒 求建议

articles.title: 装黑苹果的老板用 12 代 CPU，下架 10 代 CPU 了

articles.author: lurenjiaMAX
articles.description:
lurenjiaMAX: 
事情是这样的:
所有设备均已开启 ipv6 。

光猫-k2 路由器-xdr3010 路由器-win10 千兆台式。

xdr3010 使用 DHCP+ipv6 桥接，其他奇奇怪怪的功能没有开，比如端口自定义什么的。
nas 开了 bbr2 。

如果把 nas 接在 xdr3010 上:
xdr3010: ping k2 或者 114 ，延迟正常且无较大波动，但丢包严重。
xdr3010: 局域网网络正常，iperf3 双向测速正常。
win10 与 nas: speedtest-cli 测速下行只有 1M ，上行 50M ，网页打开极慢甚至无法打开。
在测速过程中断开 nas 不会对本次测速造成任何影响。
k2: wan 口和局域网网络均正常。
把 nas 断开或转而接在 k2 上网络则恢复正常，此时 nas 测速上行 90M 下行 60M 。
已经试过互换网线和售后更换路由器了，问题依然存在。
articles.title: 关于 TL-xdr3010 的奇怪问题

articles.author: polobug
articles.description:
polobug: 
在闲鱼上上架了一个提高效率的工具类脚本，被当成外挂。给我封号 7 天，
我提交申诉后（ 3 个工作日），结果是复合申诉失败，找客服要理由，客服说都说不清。
我拿着闲鱼官方违禁手册让客服给我具体条目，客服不指出违规条目，一直跟我说“专员已经复核，无误，无法撤销”，他们直接把专员当成最终法官，申诉的机会都没有，估计是这专员认知能力有限，看不懂我的商品。。。
直到我说 12315 投诉，他们才给我升级电话客服，客服跟我电话后就给我解除了（ 1-3 工作日）
第五天，我号才被解除，跟 7 天没什么区别
跟恶心的是，解除后，我的曝光率全是 0 ，而且我那个被误杀的商品直接被删除了，我写了一堆字说删就删。
还没任何流量补偿，太恶心了，合着我啥也没做错，被冠了个罪名，然后无罪释放后，就短信说了一句“抱歉"。
总结：遇到复读机类的人工客服，直接 12315 投诉，跟客服什么讲理都没这个管用，多打一个字都是浪费时间
闲鱼大数据误杀+专员误杀，真是误杀 2.0.
articles.title: 被闲鱼的申诉机制给恶心到了

articles.author: jackyin
articles.description:
jackyin: 
熊猫私密相册
一个保护照片和视频的私密相册，支持多层密码保护、假密码、入侵警报、紧急关闭，可通过 iCloud 云同步。
https://apps.apple.com/cn/app/panda-private-photos/id1634463152

简介
「密码保护」
多层密码保护，确保相册隐私安全。
系统密码保护，包括系统密码、面部识别、指纹识别。
独立密码，可单独设置密码保护。
假密码，可设置假密码。
「入侵警报」
可开启入侵警报功能，记录尝试入侵相册的入侵记录。
「紧急关闭」
可开启紧急关闭功能，屏幕朝下，自动退出应用。
「 iCloud 云同步」
数据可通过 iCloud 进行云同步。
做完这个 App 学到的知识
熟悉了下摄像头拍照、录像的相关操作。
熟悉了下 CloudKit 手动同步数据 + CloudKit key-value storage 。
熟悉了陀螺仪的简单使用，紧急关闭功能中有使用到，屏幕朝下，自动退出应用。
做这个 app 貌似没有学到太多的东西，再搞两个练练手，准备开始搞我一直想搞的语音社交 app 吧，有木有一直想搞社交 app 的小伙伴一起探讨探讨呀 T.T
使用促销码的方式
看别的评论里，有些小伙伴不会使用促销码，我简单说一下吧。
打开 App Store -> 点击右上角头像 -> 点击兑换礼品卡或代码 -> 输入代码即可。
进入 app ，点下恢复购买就可以生效啦。
促销码

articles.author: feimeizhan
articles.description:
feimeizhan: 
背景
在 mac 笔记本上偶尔会出现某个程序 cpu 占用率超高的（比较常见就是自带的邮件）,如果没有装相关的监控软件，就没办法得知，电池就被白白的浪费掉。不过就算装了监控软件，也没有那个是可以设置监控单位时间内耗电量达到阈值警报的功能，只能设置电量到达多少然后告警，这样没法满足我的需求。所以我自己就搞了个软件dmonitor，可以像先知一样知道电池未来耗电趋势。
功能
监控单位时间窗口内（默认 5 分钟内），如果程序耗电多就通知栏提示
耗电过多程序能在顶部菜单里的选项显示，悬浮可看到执行程序路径，点击可杀死程序
可配置开机启动
可配置监控单位时间
静默功能，可设置静默一段时间，然后自动重新监控，适合编译场景
只有一个菜单界面，从顶部菜单栏的perference呼出。
原理 /实现
界面使用electron.js
业务功能使用 [pidusage]( https://www.npmjs.com/package/@reply2future/pidusage) 获得 cpu 占用率，目前只使用 cpu 占用率作为标准
兼容性
目前只支持 macos ，手头上有monterey 12.5版本的 macbook 平稳运行一个月，发现了除mail之外，还有其他adprivacyd和spotlight的检索器等等偶尔高 CPU 的程序。
题外话
监控耗电量？目前 5 秒采集数据，耗电量理论上来说很低，从日常使用的感官上没什么差别。另外，如果有类似的程序也欢迎评论。
更多
项目地址： https://github.com/reply2future/dmonitor 欢迎 star 和 contribute 。
articles.title: macos 先知型耗电监控软件

articles.author: jeesk
articles.description:
jeesk: 
我看见有些 go 的库支持 nat 穿透，比如下面的 2 个项目。
github.com/huin/goupnp
github.com/jackpal/go-nat-pmp
问题：我测试过上面的库在我宿舍，发现他们连 nat 设备都找不到。 我宿舍的路由器是对称形。 公司的路由器是 ip 先执形，但是公司是有固定的公网 ip 的。 这个测试我没得到什么好的结论， 所以请教各位， 像 upnp 和 natpmp 一定需要公网 ip 才能穿透吗？ 还是说没有也能做？

guotao: 
类似 PC 版 Chrome 的 F12 开发者工具，手机浏览器注入 vConsole ，就可以实现简单的几个面板功能。
如图 1 ，开启开关后，打开任意网页（图 2 ），就会在左下角看到 vconsole 图标。点开，可以查看 cookie 、网络请求抓包和页面元素（图 3 ），这种需求，主要方便进行生产问题定位。
感觉还有许多网页开发需要的特性可以搞。

shuiwuyou722: 
TalentOrg ✖️ Ruby China 七夕社区轻活动 [分享] “我与 Ruby 的故事”
欢迎大家来玩
活动地址
关于我们 TalentOrg
TalentOrg 希望为尝试远程工作的互联网人才，提供全职、稳定、优质的 海外远程工作机会 ；同时通过全面的能力评估来推荐更匹配的远程工作机会，帮助大家获取更好的职业发展及较有竞争力的薪酬。

拒绝内卷、跨越 35 岁+魔咒……
未来世界的用工大概会是什么模式呢？ [ from 小编的碎碎念]
大概率不是像原有组织一样，全部都是本地线下团队？当然也可能不是 100%线上远程团队？不管是大公司还是小公司，都可能会有某种形式的线上远程团队作为一个组成部分
线上远程团队减少了固有的限制，固有的限制减少后，就会释放出价值。当可以线上远程的时候，就可以有更多的选择
终级方案就是全球的任何一个地方，只要有合适的人，就应该是可以融入到一个组织团队中去的。人才全球化~ 我们想尝试打通全球一定程度的人才供应链，从技术开始，从中国开始。解决跨语言、跨时区的团队组建以及团队管理
对远程工作有兴趣的小伙伴，欢迎探讨交流 talent@talentorg.com

articles.author: oIMOo
articles.description:
oIMOo: 
部分应用中（如 Safari ），用户可使用 Command + 数字 切换至数字对应的标签页，但是此功能不是所有应用都支持。
想给指定应用设置快捷键，macOS 中可以进入 System Preferences - Keyboard - Shortcuts - App Shortcuts 中进行设定。
然而目前遇到以下难题：
创建快捷键无法设置为动态值（不能笼统的设置为所有数字）
创建快捷键需要起名，且盲猜名字要与功能完全对应，那如题功能叫什么呢
如果对应应用程序已经有 Command + 数字的快捷键，但映射到了其他功能，且该应用内设置没有快捷键相关，如何覆盖设定
感谢
articles.title: macOS 如何创建 切换标签页 的快捷键

不过也不是不能用在普通的漫画上

articles.author: moonkiller
articles.description:
moonkiller: 去年 7 月给老妈买了台 2 手 iPhone 8Plus （看中大屏，实体 home 键，LCD 屏幕）
但毕竟是过时机型了，为了保障
就在转转平台的官方验机购买了（转转平台验机且 1 年质保）
到手后看了下没啥大问题，就装好 App 寄给老妈了
后来老妈日常使用时，偶尔无故出现找不到信号的问题
过几天又无缘无故恢复了
最后一次没信号了好几天也不见好
视频远程指导老妈尝试重启手机，更新系统后均无效
没办法申请了转转官方的寄修
转转的寄修地址还是在深圳
那时因为 YQ 还耽误了半个月不能寄（ 3 月份）
折腾了好一阵终于修完寄回来了
结果前几天和老妈视频时
她提到又出现这个问题了
我问她多久了，她说一两个月了
因为平时她都在家连 wifi ，微信沟通，所以我也没觉察到这个问题
信号毛病估计是基代出了问题
很大概率根本就没修好
我说那再让他们修一下吧
结果打开转转，发现 1 年保修期刚过
于是赶紧联系客服
结果客服就说不行，过了保修期不支持了，只能自己去维修

本来以为转转平台有个官方验机是有保障的
没想到给的还是一个基代瑕疵的机器
而且后续维修也不完善
说出来大家避雷一下😵
早知道自己去咸鱼淘了
articles.title: 避雷 58 旗下的转转平台（官方验机就是摆设）

articles.author: v2tudnew
articles.description:
v2tudnew: 
@ECHO OFF
SETLOCAL

SET par2_path="path of par2j.exe"

:GetFilePath
REM check input path
IF "%~1"=="" GOTO End
IF NOT EXIST "%~1" GOTO NextFile
IF NOT "%~x1"=="" GOTO NextFile

REM run PAR2 client
ECHO create for %1
%par2_path% c /sm2048 /rr20 /rd1 /rf3 "%~1\%~n1.par2" *

IF ERRORLEVEL 1 GOTO End

:NextFile
SHIFT
GOTO GetFilePath

:End
ENDLOCAL

如何修改让它正确识别 aaa.bbb.ccc 这类文件夹？

温馨提示：大量 offer 的产生往往在第一批笔试中！强烈建议同学们在第一批笔试前投递完成，所有事业部都如此！！
网易互娱（不可补内推 内推码：XX3CuG）
内推时间：7.26-9.28
XX3CuG
内推步骤：
https://game.campus.163.com/position/11
2 、投递过程中填写内推码 XX3CuG
OFFER 率较高岗位：
XX3CuG
互娱内推相关事宜可以私信咨询！！！
网易雷火（可补内推）
内推时间：7.5-9.28

若上面的 1 和 2 均已完成，后面还是重复收到未完成网申的信息，检查一下内推信息和网申信息是否一致，需要一致才能算内推成功。或者回帖留言和私信问我都可以

articles.description:
sciel: 
前不久在优惠信息里面买了两台腾讯云的服务器结果一台已经被更换了手机号，另一台今天又收到关联申请被取消的消息。
找客服说需要将实名信息改为自己的，改的话需要提交之前的实名资料。骗子已经拉黑我了根本联系不到。
客服说提供认证实名信息账号是会被找回的。 
您的关联申请已被取消
尊敬的腾讯云用户，您好！

articles.title: 优惠信息里面买的腾讯云服务器被骗了，发帖提示以防后面的朋友被骗。

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description:
A bold, conical structure stands on The Donum Estate in Sonoma Valley, casting a vibrant kaleidoscope of 24 colors underneath its canopy. The work of Studio Other Spaces—artist Olafur Eliasson (previously) and architect Sebastian Behmann co-founded the Berlin-based project in 2014— “Vertical Panorama Pavilion” is “inspired by the history of circular calendars,” containing 832 glass pieces arranged around an oculus opening to the north.
Drawing on the microclimate of the vineyard, the studio constructed the mosaic of translucent and transparent panels using meteorological measurements of solar radiance, wind intensity, temperature, and humidity. More
articles.title: Olafur Eliasson Designs a Canonical Structure with 832 Vibrant Glass Panels That Reflect Sonoma’s Weather

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: There have been only two documented sightings of the elusive Chirodectes maculatus, a large, soccer ball-sized jellyfish with distinct spotted markings, the second of which was captured late last year by divers from Scuba Kavieng. In what is believed to be the first recording, the video shows the extremely rare animal, which has four clusters of striped tentacles, rings covering its body, and a pulsing patch of red on its bell that’s likely a digestive cavity, as it swims near the coast of Papua New Guinea. More
articles.title: The First Video of an Extremely Rare Jellyfish Captures Its Striped Tentacles and Spotted, Pulsing Body

articles.author: Colossal
articles.description:
Every month, Colossal shares a selection of opportunities for artists and designers, including open calls, grants, fellowships, and residencies. If you’d like to list an opportunity here, please get in touch at hello@colossal.art. You can also join our monthly Opportunities Newsletter.
 
Open Calls
Faena Prize for the Arts   (International)
More
articles.title: August 2022 Opportunities: Open Calls, Residencies, and Grants for Artists

articles.author: Kate Mothes
articles.description: In The Netherlands in the 17th Century, a Golden Age was in full swing. The economy of the Dutch Republic, as it was then known, was flourishing as Antwerp and other ports became important hubs for the commercial shipping trade, importing and exporting textiles, spices, and metals, and the cities’ populations swelled. Elaborately detailed oil paintings depicting food on the table or incredible flower arrangements were popular additions to wealthy merchants’ homes, yet a more ominous genre of still-life painting also emerged amid this period of immense growth. More
articles.title: Gleaming Sculptures by Ann Carrington Examine the Underbelly of Historical Extravagance

articles.author: Paulette Beete
articles.description:
In some ways, Caledonia Curry’s work as a public artist has come full circle, an evolution she discusses in a new interview supported by Colossal Members. Curry debuted as a New York City street artist known as Swoon right around the turn of the last century, her hand-worked portraits making striking, albeit illegal, statements on old walls. Today, she harnesses that same energy into intricate—and intimate—installations set in museums and galleries.
When I look at a face for days, when I take a portrait of somebody on the street, and then I stare at that face for days and days, there’s this part of my brain that’s like, “This human is utterly perfect.
 More
articles.title: Interview: Swoon Speaks to Finding Compassion Through the Act of Looking and Unearthing Her Own Vulnerability

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: On vintage ledgers and notebooks, artist Albert Chamillard (previously) harnesses the power of crosshatching and simple outlines to render flat, geometric shapes that appear to emerge from the page. The meditative works utilize varying densities to add depth and volume to clusters of cylinders or undulating, ribbon-like forms. By rendering each piece in a monochromatic palette of black or red, the artist draws attention to the meticulously laid lines and deceptive dimension of the forms. More
articles.title: Dense Cross-Hatching Adds Deceptive Volume to Albert Chamillard’s Geometric Drawings

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Ecuadorian artist Beto Val alchemizes vintage illustrations into bizarre compositions that blend fruits with fowl and aquatic life with land animals. Using imagery available through the public domain, Val cuts and repositions fins, wings, and scaly talons into surreal creatures: round owl faces peer out from pineapples, autumn leaves sprout from tropical birds, and a rendering evocative of a biological chart displays fish with bodies made of strawberries, brains, and an early, industrial locomotive. More
articles.title: Digital Collages by Beto Val Splice Vintage Illustrations into Surreal Hybrid Creatures

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Temporarily occupying the site of the ancient Housesteads Roman Gatehouse at Hadrian’s Wall, a vibrant installation by British artist Morag Myerscough recreates the structure that once stood on the bucolic landscape in northern England. “The Future Belongs To What Was As Much As What Is” is a bright, architectural reinterpretation of the 2nd-century building, reaching the same 8.5 meters high and 12.5 meters wide as the original construction.  A staircase tucked inside the scaffolding allows visitors to climb to an upper outpost and look over the landscape, offering a view that’s been unavailable for the last 1,600 years. More
articles.title: A Bold, Architectural Installation Recreates an Ancient Roman Gatehouse with Messages of Belonging

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description:
Despite thousands of years of research and an unending fascination with marine creatures, humans have explored only five percent of the oceans covering the majority of the earth’s surface. A forthcoming book from Phaidon dives into the planet’s notoriously vast and mysterious aquatic ecosystems, traveling across the continents and three millennia to uncover the stunning diversity of life below the surface.
Spanning 352 pages, Ocean, Exploring the Marine World brings together a broad array of images and information ranging from ancient nautical cartography to contemporary shots from photographers like Sebastião Salgado and David Doubilet. More
articles.title: A New Book Plunges into the Vast Diversity of the World’s Oceans Across 3,000 Years

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description:
Encircled in roughly textured bark, thin woodcuts become canvases for the whimsical landscapes and scenes illustrated by Melpomeni Chatzipanagiotou. The Greek artist uses a combination of  pen, ink, gouache, and acrylic paint to draw outdoor vignettes cloaked in pattern and cosmic details. Nighttime skies are brimming with snowflakes, stars, and light trails that illuminate the natural subject matter and add a dose of fantasy to the heavily patterned works. 
Chatzipanagiotou has a number of illustrations on wood and paper available on Etsy, and you can watch her at work on Instagram. More
articles.title: Enchanting Vignettes Illustrated by Melpomeni Chatzipanagiotou Nestle Inside Small Wood Cuts

articles.author: Angely Mercado
articles.description:
Flash floods are some of the deadliest weather events in the U.S., and they’re becoming more common under climate change. Already in 2022, an estimated 67 Americans have perished in flood waters, and around 100 people drown in floods each year in the U.S. While you may not be able to prepare for every emergency, there…
Read more...
articles.title: 3 Things to Know That Could Save Your Life in a Flash Flood

articles.author: Matt Novak
articles.description:
The PACT Act, which allocates health care funds for U.S. veterans suffering from exposure to toxic burn pits and Agent Orange, passed the U.S. Senate on Tuesday in a vote of 86-11 and is now heading the President Joe Biden’s desk to be signed into law. Who are these politicians who voted against veterans getting the…
Read more...
articles.title: How to Contact the 11 Senators Who Voted Against Health Care for 'Burn Pit' Veterans

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
With House of the Dragon coming to HBO in just a few short weeks, the company has finally upgraded its parent show to the technical big leagues. As of August 1, HBO Max has upgraded all eight (yes, eight, unfortunately) seasons of Game of Thrones in 4K Ultra HD, HDR 10, Dolby Vision, and Dolby Atmos, the best…
Read more...
articles.title: You Can Now Actually See Stuff Game of Thrones' HBO Max Upgrade

articles.author: Sabina Graves
articles.description:
And on this day the Stranger Things writers began to run up that hill of writing the final season of Netflix and the Duffer Brothers’ hit series. They presented a whiteboard so maybe they’re just getting their stretches in before the trek. The logo is looking pretty good at least. 
Read more...
articles.title: Open Channel: Pitch Your Stranger Things Season 5 White Board Ideas

articles.author: Passant Rabie
articles.description:
Pieces of debris found on Australian farmland are suspected of originating from a SpaceX mission that launched nearly two years ago. It seems likely that the parts belong to SpaceX, but the private space company has yet to own up to the fallen remnants. 

Read more...
articles.title: Newly Fallen Space Junk in Australia Likely Belongs to SpaceX

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
Marvel’s streaming shows and movies may still steal the majority of the headlines, but the DC Extended Universe is finally giving the MCU a run for its money. The DCEU’s myriad projects are stretching far beyond  superhero mainstays Batman, Superman, and the Justice League, promising to include new and interesting…
Read more...
articles.title: DC Release Dates: When to See DCEU Movies and HBO Max Shows

articles.author: Kevin Hurler
articles.description:
The Webb Space Telescope team has unveiled the latest image from the observatory, and it’s a gorgeous portrait of the Cartwheel Galaxy, a dazzling object 500 million light-years away that formed from the high-speed collision of two galaxies.

Read more...
articles.title: Webb Space Telescope Turns Its Eye on the Chaotic Cartwheel Galaxy

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
You’re never going to see that new Batgirl movie. According to reports, Warner Bros. has decided to cancel the nearly finished project and not release it either in theaters or on HBO Max, which was the original plan. 
Read more...
articles.title: The Batgirl Movie Is Dead

articles.author: Lucas Ropek
articles.description:
It turns out that breaking an encryption algorithm meant to withstand the most powerful cyberattacks imaginable might not be as tough as we’d been led to believe. In a paper published over the weekend, researchers demonstrated that a PC with a single-core processor (weaker than a decent laptop) could break a …
Read more...
articles.title: Supposedly Quantum-Proof Encryption Cracked by Basic-Ass PC

articles.author: Mack DeGeurin
articles.description:
Robinhood, the self-proclaimed ‘Democratized Finance’ app accused of misleading and ripping off retail investors will have to cough up another $30 million to appease regulators. That raises the company’s overall regulatory penalty and settlement tab well above $100 million.
Read more...
articles.title: Robinhood Crypto Fined $30 Million by New York Regulator, Cuts 23% of Its Workforce

articles.author: Kyle Barr
articles.description:
You remember the job the 10-year-old you thought would be the best work ever, like professional video game tester (reality later proved it wasn’t such a perfect dream) or how about professional candy taste tester? Yeah, well now that you think about it, eating candy all day sounds like a really terrible idea… oh,…
Read more...
articles.title: Parents Don’t Read This: Hey Kid, Want to Make $78k a Year?

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
In the 35 years since the release of Predator, Hollywood has continually struggled to make a good sequel. Sure, the second one is okay and the ideas behind some of the others—like going to other planets and crossing over with Alien—are good, but overall, it’s rarely, if ever, panned out. So if audiences are skeptical…
Read more...
articles.title: How Mad Max: Fury Road and Star Wars Inspired the Predator Prequel, Prey

articles.author: Andrew Liszewski
articles.description:
Winamp died! And then it came back! Then it died again! And now it’s back once again, as the first release candidate of the re-resurrected Winamp 5.9 has been made available for download to a new generation who years ago transitioned away from MP3 files to streaming services.

Read more...
articles.title: Winamp Is Back (Again) to Play all Those MP3s You Don't Have

articles.author: Molly Taft
articles.description:
Isn’t it annoying when your friends borrow your private jet and rack up a truly obscene amount of carbon emissions? Happens to me all the time.
Read more...
articles.title: Taylor Swift: A Relatable, Carbon-Emitting Queen

articles.author: James Whitbrook
articles.description:
In Calexit, Matteo Pizzolo and Amancay Nahuelpan’s vision of the future imagined a dystopian world where California seceded from the United States in the wake of the election of an authoritarian president. Now, Pizzolo is returning to rip even more from tomorrow’s headlines with a similar idea: except this time it’s a…
Read more...
articles.title: Get a Look Inside Rogue State, the Spiritual Successor to Calexit

articles.author: Kyle Barr
articles.description:
Samsung has taken its first, tentative baby steps in the path toward giving users the option to self repair their devices. These new repair kits are only available for a few select models, and new parts could still cost a pretty penny.
Read more...
articles.title: Samsung Finally Unveils Self-Repair Kits, But Only For a Few Phone Models

articles.author: Sabina Graves
articles.description:
In the aftermath of the harassment Obi-Wan Kenobi star Moses Ingram recently endured, John Boyega has revisited his own experiences after being cast as Finn, a Stormtrooper turned hero, in The Force Awakens. Like Ingram, he endured ire from toxic, racist fans, and in an interview with Men’s Health, Boyega was asked if…
Read more...
articles.title: John Boyega Is Glad He Brought Awareness of Star Wars Trolls 'To the Freaking Forefront'

articles.author: Passant Rabie
articles.description:
As more private astronauts venture out into space, NASA is seeking to better regulate their journeys to Earth orbit. The space agency recently announced some updates to the set of rules required for upcoming private astronaut missions, including the stipulation that all future missions   be led by a former NASA…
Read more...
articles.title: NASA Is Changing Its Rules for Private Astronauts

articles.author: Andrew Liszewski
articles.description:
There’s nothing that can really prepare you for the rigors of being a new parent, like the crippling fatigue, but Caleb Olson has hacked together a clever way to avoid at least one challenge of having a newborn—the crying when hungry. In a move that’s sure to buy some extra ‘Zs, his new AI-powered webcam detects the…
Read more...
articles.title: Parent Creates Smart Webcam That Detects When His Baby Is Hungry

articles.author: Linda Codega
articles.description:
Gen Con is JUST AROUND THE CORNER! Nobody freak out, but if you’re not ready maybe you should freak out just a little. Also happening this month is the start of Kickstarter’s August Zine Quest, which will go back to February next year. 
Read more...
articles.title: The Gaming Shelf Celebrates the Triumphant Indie Groundbreaker Awards

articles.author: Jody Serrano
articles.description:
It seems like it was just yesterday when NFT proponents were busy trying to justify spending buckets of money on digital collectibles—and spewing tons of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere of our struggling planet—that could largely be seen for free online. But what if everyone could admire your outrageously priced…
Read more...
articles.title: Who Is This for: Tiffany's Made $48,000 IRL NFT Necklaces

articles.author: David M. Ewalt
articles.description:
Gizmodo is 20 years old! To celebrate the anniversary, we’re looking back at some of the most significant ways our lives have been thrown for a loop by our digital tools.

Read more...
articles.title: Wikipedia's Jimmy Wales on 20 Years Of Tech

articles.author: Isaac Schultz
articles.description:
The group building the Giant Magellan Telescope in Chile has secured a $205 million investment that will help push construction of the massive instrument over the finish line. The money will go toward the facility that will house the telescope at the Las Campanas Observatory high in Chile’s Atacama Desert. 
Read more...
articles.title: Planned Giant Telescope Gets a Huge Influx of Cash

articles.author: Lucas Ropek
articles.description:
Gizmodo is 20 years old! To celebrate the anniversary, we’re looking back at some of the most significant ways our lives have been thrown for a loop by our digital tools.

Read more...
articles.title: The Notorious Hacker Who’s Trying to Fix Social Media

articles.author: Kyle Barr
articles.description:
As evidenced by its namesake, apparently there wasn’t much security stopping a hoard of wandering strangers from breaking into the Nomad DeFi project’s token bridge, allowing hundreds of unknown hackers and some users to walk away with over $190 million crypto, leaving behind a bare pittance in the project’s wallet.

Read more...
articles.title: Nomad Hack Allowed 'Mob' of Users to Drain Bridge of $190 Million in Crypto
